benchmark_details.name: SARLANG-1M (Synthetic Aperture Radar Language Modeling in SAR Image Understanding)
benchmark_details.overview: SARLANG-1M is a large-scale benchmark designed for multimodal SAR image understanding, comprising over 1 million high-quality SAR image-text pairs, featuring two key components: SARLANG-1M-Cap for image captioning and SARLANG-1M-VQA for visual question answering, supporting seven key remote sensing applications.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To advance multimodal understanding of SAR images and facilitate the training and evaluation of VLMs on SAR-specific tasks.

data.source: Collected from over 59 cities worldwide, integrating images from various public SAR datasets.
data.annotation: Generated using high-quality text descriptions from SAR experts and automatic processes.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the performance of models fine-tuned on the SARLANG-1M benchmark compared against human expert evaluations.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores in metrics indicate better performance of models in interpreting and understanding SAR images.
methodology.validation: Extensive evaluation using mainstream VLMs compared against human expert performance.
